Yes, the use of color in mosaic art today is still as deliberate and intentional as it was in ancient times. Modern mosaic artists continue to use color as a powerful tool for expressing emotions, conveying meaning, and creating visual interest in their artwork. In fact, contemporary mosaic artists often push the boundaries of traditional color palettes, experimenting with bold and unexpected combinations of colors to create unique and innovative works of art.

Moreover, modern mosaic artists have access to a broader range of materials and techniques than artists in ancient times, including new tools and technologies that allow for greater precision and control over the use of color. They may also draw on a wider range of cultural traditions and influences, blending different styles and techniques to create new forms of mosaic art that reflect the diversity and complexity of our modern world.

Overall, the use of color in modern mosaic art continues to be a dynamic and multifaceted aspect of the artistic process, reflecting both tradition and innovation, as well as the individual vision and creativity of each artist.
